Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior bears nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior fainter traces of a further eight lines of text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (370770) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/370770)
